reviewText: Even though I have two boys they don't mind Angelina Ballerina at all, and there are so guys in it so it is not all girls!  "Angelina Ballerina: Pop Star Girls" is full of lots of dancing and singing.  What I like about Angelina is she does all sorts of dancing styles and not just ballet.  This DVD features a big show and everyone has to work together and work hard to make everything go as planned.  It is really a cute DVD that is bright and fun.  The songs are so upbeat and positive that it is hard for kids to sit still, even my boys were up and moving around!

reviewText: This is another Great DVD that has wonderful Stories filled with Friends working together and Great Music and Songs combined. This is sure pure fun for Children and Families and Friends!
summary: Great Entertaining Stories and Awesome Lessons on this Amazing DVD!

reviewerName: Danielle Greenhouse "Author of What They Left...
reviewText: I got this for my daughter because I had a coupon for it, and Angelina Ballerina is one of the few kids shows I actually like to watch.There are 3 episodes of Angelina Ballerina, and a surprising number of bonus features.Two of the three episodes show Angelina not on her best behavior.  Sometimes she can be a little prima donna (some might say 'spoiled rotten brat') and this might be a off-putting for people who are used to mild mannered cartoon characters.  But she usually gets over it.  Also, Sammy, the bully, is pure evil.  My guess is he'll grow up to be Mouseland's first serial killer.  I think he says a mild swear word in the one episode he's in.  Some people might be offended by this.  The Halloween episode is really adorable, though  The 'stinky cheese' myth is kind of funny.  Overall, the cartoon is cute, and I like the characters' voices.  It has a really quaint homey feel.  The Little Stars segments are really excellent.  You learn a lot about the world of ballet.  The real life dancers are very good, even the little kids.The bonus features are good, especially if you're into ballet.  There's little games and they show you all the ballet moves.  Overall, I would recommend this DVD for kids, especially if they like ballet or Angelina Ballerina.  Adults won't mind watching it either.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I guess I should have put a 3 year old girls delight, but now we're in the latest millennia... anyway's...my little girls loves all of the Angelina Ballerina movies, and even my seven year old daughter will sit and watch along too. She did make a comment though  that this particular movie was different, probably because it was a actual British version ( I think..) as opposed to the American version.I'm giving it a three just because it was different . It will however still captivate your little one's attention.

reviewText: "Angelina Ballerina - Lights, Camera, Action!"  features the lovable yet flawed mouseling, Angelina teaming up with her friends to give us 4 entertaining episodes. In "Lights, Camera, Action!", Angelina enters a movie-making contest and ropes in her best friend Alice, cousin Henry and friend William to assist, but goes overboard with her high expectations, until she is finally brought back down to earth, literally.In "Anya's Visit", Angelina's old friend Anya comes to visit from Dachovia, but Angelina's initial enthusiasm gives way to resentment and jealousy, causing Anya to be hurt by her friend's attitude. In the end however, Angelina realises her faults and makes amends.In "Henry's Halloween",Angelina's cousin Henry thinks he's seen the Chipping Cheddar Witch, much to the amusement of Angelina and friends. But a surprising turn of events has Angelina and Alice very thankful to him."Sammy's Club" has troublemaker Sammy and his friends leaving William out of their downhill racer club, until their racer breaks and only William's dad can help them fix it.Besides the 4 episodes, there are bonus features such as a Matching DVD Game, a dress-up with Angelina game, and Angelina's dance class. The total running time is abt 52 mins.
Title: N/A
